reviews.text: My family of three (including a 15-month-old child) stayed at this hotel for three days. It's a nice hotel in a very good location -- close to subway and right next to the Oriental Pearl tower. There's also a nice walkway along the river right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: 5-star facilities, but other aspects need improvements

reviews.text: Our room is quite spacious, with a nice view of The Bund. The bathroom is big too, with separate tub and shower. The hotel also provided us a nice crib upon request. They also provide bath robes, slippers, lots of toiletries (including razors), a shoe horn, a clothes brush, etc., as standard items. So, in terms of facilities, it is a 5-star hotel. However, the carpet is not clean, and the windows need cleaning also. (It's true that cleanliness is not a strong point wherever you go in China.) The hotel staff is in general courteous and responsive to all our requests, but their English is not very good. I found the lights in the hotel room were too dim. The other problem was that the sound insulation was not good enough. At night I could hear the voices from next door.
reviews.title: A conveniently located, comfortable hotel, with detached, unfriendly staff with 'cold' expressions!

reviews.text: We ordered room service for breakfast and dinner for all three days. The price is comparable to (and may be slightly cheaper than) those of other 4-star hotels I stayed in in North America. The menu is pretty basic, but the food was well prepared.

reviews.text: This is the first visit to China. Payment culture is different than other countries that I visited where you only pay up after the stay or perhaps just a deposit. Make sure your credit card works overseas with a high credit limit or you have enough cash to pay up not only the total of the room rent for the duration of the stay but also additional costs which sum up to nearly twice the total rent for the days that had been booked.
reviews.title: Prepare to pay nearly twice the room rate for the duration of the stay upfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a business conf. Most taxi drivers didn't seem to know this hotel, so pre-print a map if you're taking a taxi here. Check in was complicated because there was an error and though everyone kept smiling, the English-language skills of the check-in staff was very poor. this difficulty with communication persisted throughout the stay - the concierge couldn't understand my requests for help with restaurants and circus tickets, and I just couldn't get my request for an iron and ironing board understood despite multiple attempts. My guide later told me that it's a government-run property, so there's little incentive for anyone to 'serve'. The room itself was adequate, but smelled of smoke (on a non-smoking floor). The bathrooms have been updated and were impressive. I appreciated the free internet in the room. Breakfast was a real disappointment - a multitude of staff (most seemed to mill around aimlessly) and a wide array of food offerings (local and international), but nothing was kept warm (resulting in soggy food), and a good deal of the food didn't seem fresh (incl breads and sweets). The noodle station only operated periodically it seemed. Overall it was a functional, great bathrooms and free internet, but service and food below par, and communications really challenging.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 days and found the hotel was of a very hight standard. We had a standard garden view room and this was great. Had a view of Pudong hi rises including the Oriental Pearl Tower. Convenient hotel for sightseeing as bus stop was next to hotel. Tourist tunnel right by the front door of hotel gave access to The Bund. Breakfast was plentiful and good variety. Only negative was very limited information available in English. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful view, spacious room, 5-star facilities with 3-star price

reviews.text: I was really impressed with the hotel. Room is really spacious, deluxe riverview has a lovely view of the bund, lots of closet space, beautiful bathroom, especially the shower, good service. Staff was so helpful with taxi arrangement and find out my terminal when I was late catching my flight. Though i was not a fan of their breakfast, which was not included in my package so it would cost USD 40 (!) - a bit too much for breakfast. But I cannot complain, Starbuck is across the road. My colleague stayed next door at Shangri-la with a much smaller room and double the price.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!
